title: The Writer's Almanac - Tuesday, May 4, 2021
description: Horace Mann was born this day in 1796.  An advocate of public education and an opponent of slavery, he said,  “Be ashamed to die until you have won some victory for humanity.”
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: Horace Mann was born this day in 1796.  An advocate of public education and an opponent of slavery, he said,  “Be ashamed to die until you have won some victory for humanity.”
